title: Controlling light-with-light without nonlinearity
abstract: According to the fundamental Huygens superposition principle, light beams traveling in a linear medium will pass though one another without mutual disturbance. Indeed, the field of photonics is based on the premise that controlling light signals with light requires intense laser fields to facilitate beam interactions in nonlinear media, where the superposition principle can be broken. Here we challenge this wisdom and demonstrate that two coherent beams of light of arbitrarily low intensity can interact on a metamaterial layer of nanoscale thickness in such a way that one beam modulates the intensity of the other. We show that the interference of beams can eliminate the plasmonic Joule losses of light energy in the metamaterial or, in contrast, can lead to almost total absorption of light. Applications of this phenomenon may lie in ultrafast all-optical pulse-recovery devices, coherence filters and terahertz-bandwidth light-by-light modulators.
abstract_cn: 根据基本的惠更斯叠加原理，在线性介质中传播的光束将互相通过而不会相互干扰。 实际上，光子学领域是基于这样的前提，即用光控制光信号需要强烈的激光场，以促进非线性介质中的光束相互作用，在这种情况下，叠加原理可能会被打破。 在这里，我们挑战这种智慧并证明，任意强度低的两个相干光束可以在纳米级厚度的超材料层上相互作用，从而一个光束调制另一个光束的强度。 我们表明，光束的干扰可以消除超材料中等离子焦耳的光能损失，或者相反，它可以导致几乎完全吸收光。 这种现象的应用可能在于超快全光脉冲恢复设备，相干滤波器和太赫兹带宽逐光调制器。

title: Metallic subwavelength-cavity semiconductor nanolasers
title_cn: 金属亚波长腔半导体纳米激光器
abstract: Miniaturization has been an everlasting theme in the development of semiconductor lasers. One important breakthrough in this process in recent years is the use of metal-dielectric composite structures that made truly subwavelength lasers possible. Many different designs of metallic cavity semiconductor nanolasers have been proposed and demonstrated. In this article, we will review some of the most exciting progresses in this newly emerging field. In particular, we will focus on metallic-cavity nanolasers with volume smaller than wavelength cubed under electrical injection with emphasis on high-temperature operation. Such devices will serve as an important component in the future integrated nanophotonic systems due to its ultra-small size.
abstract_cn: 微型化一直是半导体激光器发展的永恒主题。 近年来，该过程中的一项重要突破是使用金属-电介质复合结构，这使真正的亚波长激光器成为可能。 已经提出并证明了金属腔半导体纳米激光器的许多不同设计。 在本文中，我们将回顾这个新兴领域中一些最令人兴奋的进展。 特别是，我们将重点研究体积小于电注入下立方波长的金属腔纳米激光器，重点是高温操作。 由于其超小尺寸，此类设备将成为未来集成纳米光子系统的重要组件。
